ygData.subject: RE: [Re: Market in EQ]
ygData.msgSnippet: If this were to be implemented, rare magic items would probably be excluded. We re only talking about common non-magical items that would wear out over time.
ygData.messageBody:
If this were to be implemented, rare magic items would probably be excluded.
We're only talking about common non-magical items that would wear out over
time. And you don't have to make the item totally disappear. A better way to
do is to have the AC value of the item drop until it hits, let's say 1, then
it's time to go get it repaired. Again, I like the system the way it is.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jason Coan [SMTP:COANJ@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, July 14, 1999 10:09 AM
> To: EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Market in EQ]
>
> From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
>
> OK, simple question, how many of you people that are for items
> deteriorating and going poof have any magic plate? (none I'd bet)
>
> I've spent about 2 months to get the armor that I am now wearing, I'd be
> pissed to an extreem if I were in the middle of a fight and I see a
> message "Your Charred Black Tunic has fallen appart". That one piece of
> armor alone took me the better part of week to get.
>
> Ok, so you say I should have to get it repaired by a smith. I am DE, and
> by choice I have lowered my faction to the point where I will never be
> able to go into Freeport or Rivervale, and due to built in factions, I can
> not go to any other elf city nor can I go into gnome, dwarf, or barbarian
> city. Which means that I would have to search, not only for a respectable
> smith that I trusted, but also an evil one, or trek my self across the
> world to Qeynos. Simply to get my armor "repaired". Now if that isn't
> bad enough.....
>
> Often my group will go deep into a dungeon, deep to the point where either
> a caster has to group gate us to get us out, or we have to spend 30-45 min
> fighting out way out of the dungeon. And quite often we'll all camp and
> logout in a "safe" spot in the dungeon, so sometimes we will be in a
> dungeon litterly for days. Now, say I get the message "your rubicite helm
> is begining to weaken, you should take it for repairs soon", that means
> that my entire group would have to leave the dungeon so that I might quest
> to get my armor repaired.
>
> I find neither to be acceptable. What I do find about this, is that there
> are some smiths who think they don't make enough money, so they want armor
> to wear out, so it has to either be replaced or repaired (more money for
> smiths). What they fail to concider is the fact that you will not always
> be wearing banded armor.
>
> >>> Peter Wong <lkworthpete@...> 7.14.99 9:19:45 AM >>>
> From: Peter Wong <lkworthpete@...>
>
> XxKommiexX@... wrote:
> From: XxKommiexX@...
>
> It would make people too mad. Having a nice piece of magic armor that took
>
> forever to get disappear because it wore out. I don't like this idea, as
> it
> would just make EQ more like Diablo and Ultima Online, which I hope they
> would want to try and stay away from.
>
> ------------------------------------------
>
> Some other RPG's I've played made it so that common wear items wore
> quicker
> than others as well as making rare quest items not wear very little or not
> at
> all since they are supposed to be considered priceless. I think the idea
> of
> making items wear would be a great thing for the trade. A shield and
> sword
> would wear quicker than say boots or leggings. This gives smiths an
> oppurtunity to increase their skills with less cost if they want to work
> on
> repairing and improving items.
>
> Cerran
